definition: to use all one's willpower (to do sth)/to hang in there
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support

sentences.english: When liu town, irrespective of the sunset ginger smoke stop strong body comes out looking for the proposed Ann.
sentences.chinese: 柳时镇不顾姜暮烟的阻止，强撑着身体出来寻找提安。

sentences.english: Hereupon, she is strong to support to touch come to hand machine, stir for neighbourhood to tie to plea for help a telephone.
sentences.chinese: 于是，她强撑着摸到手机，给邻居拨打了求救电话。

definition: to make oneself do sth in spite of adversity, pain etc
to strive/to make an effort/to exert oneself
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
to pretend to look happy/to force oneself to smile
see 咬緊牙關|咬紧牙关[yao3 jin3 ya2 guan1]
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
